quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Colorado and Florida
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, discovery, miami. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What city is the Kennedy Space Center located in?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cape Canaveral

questions.question: What city is the Walt Disney World Resort located in?
This mountain in Lake County, Colorado, is the highest of the Rocky Mountains.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mt. Elbert

questions.question: Miami University is in Florida.
The Tenth Amendment of the United States Bill of Rights states that any powers not given to the Federal Government are given to the state or the people.
The Rocky Mountains within the state of Colorado, contain how many peaks over 14,000 ft?
What is the oldest port in the continental United States?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: St. Augustine

questions.question: Who discovered Florida?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Juan Ponce de León

questions.question: Walter E. Disney was born in Florida.
This fort, established in 1858 and commanded by the legendary frontiersman Kit Carson, was the first and oldest military post in Colorado.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fort Garland

questions.question: This amendment concerning the right to own and bear arms is considered by many the most contreversal one on the United States Bill of Rights.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Second amendment

questions.question: The freedom of speech, religion, petition and assembly are outlined in this amendment of the United States Bill of Rights.
This road, which traverses Rocky Mountain National Park from Estes Park, Colorado in the east to Grand Lake in the west, is the highest paved-through highway in the United States.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Trail Ridge Road

questions.question: What discovery on the territory of Colorado became known as “The Richest Square Mile on Earth”?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Gregory Lode

questions.question: In what city in Florida is the University of Miami located?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Coral Gables

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Rights and The United States
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, network, products. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: At the beginning of his show he says, At no point are actors or stooges used in this show or  There were no actors or stooges used in this show?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Derren Brown

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: James Madison

questions.question: The United States Constitution and the United States Bill of Rights were adopted at the same time.
Which amendment of the United States Bill of Rights gives the defendant the right to be judged by jury?
Which amendment of the United States Bill of Rights protects the individual from unreasonable search and seizures?
What products ad says expect wonders?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bayer Aspirin

questions.question: Kelly Ripa has done commercials for Tide on the Run Stick which can remove fresh drink and food stains in a flash.
Responsibility Matters is one of this companys slogans.
This politician did not originally want a Bill of Rights for the United States.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Thomas Jefferson

questions.question: Which was the tenth state to approve the United States Bill of Rights?
Which amendment of the United States Bill of Rights prohibits cruel and unusual punishment?
Chuck Norris and Christie Brinkley pitch ads for Bowflex.
How many Pennsylvania cities have served as capital of the USA?
Whose statue is at the top of Philadelphias City Hall?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: William Penns

questions.question: What network has the slogan We report, You decide?

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Bethlehem and City
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, actor, world. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This landmark built by Constantine the Great stands in the center of Bethlehem.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Church of the Nativity

questions.question: Which of these states does not border Pennsylvania?
During the Samaritan Revolt the Church of the Nativity in Bethlehem was destroyed.
A song by the name of December has been done by all of the following bands except this band.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Stone Temple Pilots

questions.question: Commodore Oliver Hazard Perry won a major naval battle in the War of 1812 using this Pennsylvania city as his base.
What popular actor was born on December 17, 1953 and played characters named Dennis Alan (1988), Bob Hinson (1992), Ed Masterson (1994), President Thomas J. Whitmore (1996) and Peter Kirk (2004)?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bill Pullman

questions.question: An estimated 2,000 Christians left Bethlehem during the period of 2000 - 2003.
Bethlehem is six miles south of what city?
Which river flows through Pennsylvanias capital city, Harrisburg?
In 1940, the population of Bethlehem was mostly Christian.
Which of these groups was forced to leave when Saladin captured Bethlehem?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Latin Clerics

questions.question: Billy Dee Williamss middle name is December.
Lt. George Washington first made a name for himself by defeating the French in the battle at Fort Necessity in 1754.
In 2002, this building in Bethlehem became the site of a five-week standoff during the Israel Defense Leagues raid on the city.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Church of the Nativity

questions.question: This king, born in Bethlehem, was the second King of Israel.

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: State and U.s.
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, independence, navel. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In what state was a person executed by lethal injection on December 14, 1982?

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Oklahoma City

On December 1, 1913 Ford Motor Company introduced standard seatbelts.
What is the least populated U.S. state capital according to the 2000 census?

Here, at what legend says Zeus called the navel of the world, Apollo killed a winged snake whose blood gave prophetic visions to those who inhaled its fumes. By what better name do we know the seer, Pythia?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Oracle of Delphi

questions.question: What is the state capital of the U.S. state of Iowa?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Des Moines

questions.question: Which state was the first of the original 13 to ratify the United States Constitution in 1787?
What is the capital city of the U.S. state in which the largest city is Bridgeport?

This dome, the largest free-standing brick dome in the world, is a symbol of the Eternal City. Its beauty was shaped by Raphael, Bernini and Michelangelo. Here is housed Michelangelos Pieta, the only sculpture he ever signed. In what building would you be standing when you read upon this rock I will build my church. To you I give the kingdom of heaven.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: St. Peters Basilica

questions.question: Which of the following countries gained its independence from Russia in December of 1917?
What is the capital city of the U.S. state in which the largest city is Newark?

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Illinois and Pennsylvania
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, nicknames, bird. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What is the official state bird of Illinois?
This animal, which is often hunted in the fall season, is the official state animal of Illinois.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: White-tailed deer

questions.question: The name Illinois is Algonquin for tribes of intelligent men.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Prairie State

questions.question: Which of the following is one of the nicknames of Pennsylvania?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Keystone State

questions.question: Illinois is the leading producer in the U.S. of which of these crops?
The Sugar Maple is the state tree of Pennsylvania.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ronald Reagan

questions.question: The first night football game was played in this city.
In what year did Illinois enter the Union?
How many counties does Illinois have?

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: James Buchanan

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mountain Laurel
